results.title: A Fair cop
results.creator_credit: Craig Kirchner, John Cruthers, Steven Salgo, Seon Film Productions and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: A film, for young people to see, that emphasises road safety for cyclists. The film is a fictional dramatisation of a policeman on patrol who encounters some careless riders.

results.title: A Doll's house: by Henrik Ibsen
results.creator_credit: Patrick Garland, Hillard Elkins and Elkins Productions
results.brief_description: Ibsen’s feminist play set is Norway depicts Nora Helmer (Claire Bloom), a woman struggling for independence within her marriage, and against her husband’s will (played by Anthony Hopkins). In the face of male obstinacy and arrogance she sets off in search of her own life and destiny and breaks the shackles which have persisted in treating her as if she were a doll. Cast includes Denholm Elliot, Ralph Richardson and Edith Evans. Another version of Ibsens’s play, directed by Joseph Losey was released in the same year starring Jane Fonda and David Werner.

results.title: A Dog of Flanders
results.creator_credit: James B. Clark, Robert B Radnitz, Associated producers, TCF and DeLuxe Cinemascope
results.brief_description: 12 year old Nello lives with his grandfather near Antwerp. They manage to eke a living by delivering milk into the city. Nello dreams of becoming a famous artist like Ruebens and is able to satisfy his interest by befriending a painter. One day while returning from a delivery Nello discovers a dog, left for dead in the bushes. They take him home and restore his health. The owner soon turns up to reclaim his dog, fortunately he is unsuccessful. This is only the start to Nello’s troubles as his grandfather dies, leaving Nello without enough money to look after himself, let alone the dog. A touching story that will appeal to the whole family. Starring David Ladd, Donald Crisp and Theodore Bikel. Based on the novel by Ouida.

results.title: From India to Nepal
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

group_works.title: A Distant sound of bugles
group_works.creator_credit: Michael Pearce, Keith Adam, Royal Nepal Film Corporation and ABC

results.title: A Distant sound of bugles
results.creator_credit: Michael Pearce, Keith Adam, Royal Nepal Film Corporation and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “From India to Nepal”.
Siriparsad Guring returns to his Himalayan village after a 4-year term in a Gurkha regiment. He buys some land to farm and tries to settle back into village life with his wife and young child. After a few months he grows restless, realising that army service has alienated him from his former lifestyle. Narrated by John Gaden.

results.title: A Director talks about his film
results.creator_credit: David Grotenstein, Peter Riegert, Susan Krebs and Prospective Films
results.brief_description: A satirical film depicting an interview with an Italian film director, Aldo Altonandino who’s remarks in Italian are translated into English by a deadpanned, uninvolved female interpreter. As he gets carried away by his pseudo-eloquence the translator continues in robot-like fashion. As the camera pulls back, the real director appears explaining his idea for the film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Grotenstein, Peter Riegert, Susan Krebs and Prospective Films

results.title: A Heart in winter = Un Coeur en hiver
results.creator_credit: Claude Sautet, Philippe Carcassonne, Jean-Louis Livi, FR3, Paravision International, D.A. Films, SEDIF, Orly Films, Cinea and Film Par Film
results.brief_description: Daniel Auteil and Emmanuelle Beart (the leading actors from Manon Des Sources) star in this triangular love story which explores the darker recesses of the heart and soul; where emotion is repressed. Two longtime friends in the classical music world find their friendship is threatened when a beautiful woman enters their lives. Ravel’s music forms a striking background to the drama as one woman embarks on a journey of surrender to passion.

results.title: A Handful of dust
results.creator_credit: Charles Sturridge, Derek Granger, Stagescreen and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Tony and Brenda Last (James Wilby and Kristin Scott Thomas) appear to be the perfect married ccouple - with money, position, a great country house and an adored son, John Andrew. When Tony inadvertently invites John Beaver (Rupert Graves), an idle and penniless young socialite, to stay for the weekend, he sets in motion a series of events which drastically disrupts the course of all their lives. Brenda drifts into an affair with the worthless Mr. Beaver, with disastrous consequences, particularly for Tony, who remains unaware of Brenda’s betrayal until the tragic death of their young son. As Brenda leaves home to take up a precarious life with her lover in London. Tony sets sail with an eccentric explorer on an expedition to the South American rain forests. Lost in the jungle and stricken by fever, Tony is rescued from death by the eccentric Mr. Todd (Alec Guinness) with unexpected and sinister results.

results.title: A guide to landscape painting with Del Newport
results.creator_credit: Leigh Kidd, Val Osborn, Robert Dunn and Coral Coast Video
results.brief_description: Del Newport, prominent teacher and exhibition artist with national and overseas recognition shows step by step the fine detail and intricacies of landscape painting. As she paints a landscape from memory, Del explains what she is doing and why.
